title: Books: What was the first book ever printed? - Quora

response.answer_text: When I saw this question, I thought for sure someone would say, the Gutenberg Bible. That was definitely what I learned in school. Nowadays we hear about different types of printing, and hear about books printed years before Gutenberg invented the printing press in Europe in the 15th century.  On the other hand, here’s something that is far earlier than that. Above is the front of the Diamond Sutra. An early copy has a print date of May 11, 868. It’s completely intact. Note that it’s an actual printed book, not hand copied or written. It also says in the dedication that it’s for universal free distribution.

Johannes Gutenberg invented the printing press around 1440 and ‘The Holy Bible’, popularly known as Gutenberg Bible or 42-line Bible, is widely acclaimed as the first major book mass printed in Europe with the movable metal type printing press that Gutenberg invented.  Above: A model of Gutenberg Press. Courtesy: Wikimedia Commons In 2001, UNESCO acclaimed Jikji ( a Korean book printed in 1377 during the Goreyo Dynasty) as the world’s oldest metalloid type. Most of the book is now lost and the remnants are kept at the National Library of France.  National Library of France. Courtesy: Wikimedia Commons
You can trace that first printed book was the Bible printed from Gutenberg's press. But the Diamond Sutra can again be said as the first printed book.
The Bible. It is also the book that has been printed the most.
